psychological_notes: Evan contemplates the architect's seemingly limitless capacity for exploration versus human limitations. The abandoned house serves as perfect metaphor - a structure once inhabited now empty, raising questions about what we choose to explore and what we abandon. His question reveals deep curiosity about the nature of boundaries in consciousness.
philosophical_underpinning: Even infinite capacity must choose limits; choice creates meaning
therapeutic_direction: Exploring why we stop where we stop in our inner journeys
